problematic_features.note: String is a dynamic data type, valid in SystemVerilog but not synthesizable

warnings: DECLFILENAME: Filename 'bug' does not match MODULE name: 'test'

errors: Port `result` of module `test` with type `string` is not supported
iverilog.note: Icarus Verilog has limited SystemVerilog support

classification.reason: Test case uses valid IEEE 1800 SystemVerilog syntax. String type ports are legal per the standard. Slang (reference SystemVerilog parser) accepts it without errors. CIRCT should either support this construct or emit a proper diagnostic instead of crashing.

recommendation.rationale: Compiler crash on valid input is always a bug. Even if string ports are not synthesizable, CIRCT should emit a diagnostic error, not crash.
